meanings.definition: The state or quality of being stale.
meanings.sent1: The stalenesses of the bread made it hard to eat.
meanings.sent2: The stalenesses of the air in the closed room was noticeable.
meanings.sent3: The stalenesses of the jokes at the party made everyone groan.
meanings.sent4: The stalenesses of the relationship was like a heavy fog between them.
meanings.sent5: The stalenesses of the news lingered in the room like a bad smell.

meanings.definition: The condition of lacking freshness or vigor.
meanings.sent1: She could feel the stalenesses of her ideas as she tried to write.
meanings.sent2: The stalenesses of the old bread was evident in its taste.
meanings.sent3: The stalenesses of the meeting made it hard to stay awake.
meanings.sent4: The stalenesses of the routine drained all excitement from her life.
meanings.sent5: The stalenesses of the air in the room felt heavy and oppressive.
